q:
Which of the following statements is correct about the given CSS3 code:

Code

a:link , a:visited { 

background-color: blue;

}

a:hover {

background-color: yellow;

}

<a href = "test.html"> Hi </a>

Options

  1. It creates a button having the background color blue.
  2. It creates a link having the background color blue and on hover, the background color will be yellow.
  3. It creates a link having the background color yellow.
  4. It creates a button having the background color blue and on hover, the color will change to yellow.

You are given the following HTML and CSS code. If you are required to execute this code, then which of the following statements about its output is correct:
Code

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <style>
            body {

                background: #FF0000; /*Red*/
            }
            section {
                background: #FFFF00; /*Yellow*/
                height: 200px;
            }
        </style>
    </head>
    <body>
        <section>
            Hello HackerEarth!
        </section>
    </body>
</html>

Statements

  1. "Hello HackerEarth!" will be inside a red-colored section with a yellow-colored body background.
  2. "Hello HackerEarth!" will be inside a yellow-colored section with a red-colored body background.
  3. "Hello HackerEarth!" will be inside a red-colored body background only as the color of the section is overridden by the body.
  4. "Hello HackerEarth!" will be inside a yellow-colored background only as the color of the body is overridden by the section.

What will be the color of the text "Hello" in the following HTML5 code?

Code:

<html>
<head>
<style>
 ul#decoration #list {
    color: green;
 }
 .like span {
    color: yellow!important;
 }
</style>
</head>

<body>

<ol class="greet" id="decoration">
    <li>Hi</li>
    <li class="like" id="list"><span class="hello">Hello</span></li>
</ol>

</body>
</html>

What will be the color of the text "Noice" in the following HTML5 code?

Code:

<html>
<head>
<style>
 ol.greet li .hello {
    color: brown;
  }
  ol.greet li .hello:nth-of-type(odd) {
    color: black;
  }
</style>
</head>
<body>
<ol class="greet" id="decoration">
    <li>Hi</li>
    <li class="like" id="list"><span class="hello">Noice</span></li>
</ol>
</body>
</html

What will be the output of the following HTML5 / CSS3 code?

Code

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
   <head>
      <style>
         .hack-container {
         display: flex;
         justify-content: space-around;
         background-color: black;
         flex-direction: row;
         }
         .hack-container > div {
         background-color: white;
         width: 50px;
         text-align: center;
         line-height: 50px;
         font-size: 20px;
         margin: 1px;
         }
      </style>
   </head>
   <body>
      <div class="hack-container">
         <div>H</div>
         <div>A</div>
         <div>C</div>
         <div>K</div>
      </div>
   </body>
</html>



Output




  1.  



  2.  



  3.

What will be the output of the following HTML5 / CSS3 code?

 

Code

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
   <head>
      <style>
         .hack-container {
         display: flex;
         justify-content: flex-end;
         background-color: black;
         flex-direction: row-reverse;
         }
         .hack-container > div {
         background-color: white;
         width: 50px;
         text-align: center;
         line-height: 50px;
         font-size: 20px;
         margin: 1px;
         }
      </style>
   </head>
   <body>
      <div class="hack-container">
         <div style="order: 3; flex-grow: 4">H</div>
         <div style="order: 4; flex-shrink: 4">A</div>
         <div style="order: 2; flex-grow: 4">C</div>
         <div style="order: 1; align-self: center; flex-grow: 4">K</div>
         <div style="order: 5; flex-shrink: 4">R</div>
      </div>
   </body>
</html>


Output





  1.  




  2.  




  3.

What will be the output of the following  HTML5 / CSS3 code?

Code

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
   <head>
      <style>
         .hack-container {
         display: flex;
         justify-content: flex-end;
         background-color: black;
         flex-direction: row-reverse;
         }
         .hack-container > div {
         background-color: white;
         width: 50px;
         text-align: center;
         line-height: 50px;
         font-size: 20px;
         margin: 1px;
         }
      </style>
   </head>
   <body>
      <div class="hack-container">
         <div style="order: 3; flex-grow: 4">H</div>
         <div style="order: 4; flex-shrink: 4">A</div>
         <div style="order: 2; flex-grow: 2">C</div>
         <div style="order: 1; flex-shrink: 1">K</div>
      </div>
   </body>
</html>



Output



  1.  


  2.  


  3.

What will be the output of the following HTML5 / CSS3 code?

Code

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
   <head>
      <style>
         .hackerearth-container {
         display: grid;
         grid-template-columns: auto auto auto auto;
         grid-gap: 1px;
         background-color: black;
         padding: 1px;
         }
         .hackerearth-container > div {
         background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255);
         text-align: center;
         padding: 1px 0;
         font-size: 15px;
         }
         .h2 {
         grid-column: 2 / span 2;
         }
         .h9 {
         grid-column: 3 / span 1;
         grid-row: 3;
         }
         .h5 {
         grid-column: 1 / span 2;
         grid-row: 3;
         }
         .h15 {
         grid-column: 4 ;
         grid-row: 4 / span 2;
         }
         .h14 {
         grid-column: 3;
         grid-row: 4;
         }
         .h17 {
         grid-column: 2 / span 2 ;
         }
      </style>
   </head>
   <body>
      <div class="hackerearth-container">
         <div class="h1">A</div>
         <div class="h2">B</div>
         <div class="h3">C</div>
         <div class="h4">D</div>
         <div class="h5">E</div>
         <div class="h6">F</div>
         <div class="h7">G</div>
         <div class="h8">H</div>
         <div class="h9">I</div>
         <div class="h10">J</div>
         <div class="h12">K</div>
         <div class="h13">L</div>
         <div class="h14">M</div>
         <div class="h15">N</div>
         <div class="h16">O</div>
         <div class="h17">P</div>
      </div>
   </body>
</html>



Output




  1.  



  2.  



  3.

What will be the output of the following HTML5 / CSS3 code?

 

Code

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
   <head>
      <style>
         .hackerearth-container {
         display: grid;
         grid-gap: 1px;
         background-color: black;
         padding: 1px;
         }
         .hackerearth-item {
         background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255);
         text-align: center;
         padding: 2px;
         font-size: 15px;
         }
         .h1 {
         grid-column: 1 / span 2;
         grid-row: 1;
         }
         .h2 {
         grid-column: 3;
         grid-row: 1 / span 2;
         }
         .h5 {
         grid-column: 1 / span 3;
         grid-row: 3;
         }
      </style>
   </head>
   <body>
      <div class="hackerearth-container">
         <div class="hackerearth-item h1">A</div>
         <div class="hackerearth-item h2">B</div>
         <div class="hackerearth-item h3">C</div>
         <div class="hackerearth-item h4">D</div>
         <div class="hackerearth-item h5">E</div>
      </div>
   </body>
</html>

 

Output




  1.  



  2.  




  3.

In CSS3, you have created an image modal with an image named hackmyimage.jpg and with an ID myImg. JavaScript is used to trigger the modal and to display the current image inside your modal. Which of the following attributes is used to make the modal image invisible when the cursor is placed on it:

  1. @-webkit-keyframes zoom {
    from {-webkit-transform: scale(0)} 
    to {-webkit-transform: scale(0)}
}
  2. .modal {display: none}
  3. #myImg:hover {opacity: 0;}

In CSS3, you are working on the animation property. If you have implemented the @keyframes at-rules in your script, then which of the following nested at-rules is used to determine the aspect of the change of the layout that can be applied while you are printing the document?

In CSS3, which of the following statements about the Responsive Web Design approach are correct:
    1. This technique is used to conserve the memory adaptability in the response events.
    2. This is a JavaScript mechanism that completely depends on functional and recurring data responsive programming techniques.

In CSS3, you are working on the Responsive Web Design approach. You have set a viewport for your website that contains an image and some information on an Android mobile of screen width 1440 pixels. It provides a poor user experience if you try to scroll the screen horizontally.
    Which of the following precautions must be taken in this scenario to resolve this issue:
    1. The width of the image must be less than or equal to 1440 pixels.
    2. The width of the content in the viewport is the same as for any device.
    3. CSS media queries must be used to apply styling for this screen resolution.

In CSS3, you are working on the Responsive Web Design approach. If you are required to perform various operations on media queries, then which of the following statements about media features in the @media rule are correct:
    1. The aspect-ratio feature is used to determine the ratio between the height and width of the particular device screen.
    2. The max-resolution feature is used to determine the minimum screen resolution of a particular device by using the Dots Per Inch (DPI) measuring technique.
    3. The min-monochrome feature is used to determine the minimum number of bits that are available per color on a grayscale device.

In CSS3, you are working on 2D transformations. You have embedded an image on your web page. If you are required to increase the size of your image such that the height should be 3 times greater than the original size of the image and the width should be 2 times greater than the original size of the image, then which of the following syntaxes is used to perform this task?

In CSS3, you are working on 3D transformations. Which of the following statements about transformation properties are correct:
    1. The transform properties are used to change the position of transformed elements.
    2. The transform-style property is used to determine how the nested elements are rendered in a 3D space.
    3. The perspective-origin property is used to determine the bottom position of 3D elements.
    4. The backface-visibility property is used to determine if an element must be visible when it is not displayed on the screen.

In CSS3, you are working on style images. If you are required to put an image image.jpg at the center of your website, then which of the following operations must be performed in your corresponding CSS file:
    1. display: center;
    2. margin-left: auto;
    3. margin-right: auto;
    4. display: block;

In CSS3, you are working on buttons. You have created a website in which you have embedded a button to display an image on your website. You have included the hover effect to this button by using the : hover selector such that when the cursor is placed on the button, the background color of the button changes to green. If you are required to determine the speed of the hover effect on your button, then which of the following properties must be included in the CSS file to perform this task?

In CSS3, you are working on buttons. If you are required to add the shadow effect to your button on your website, then which of the following properties must be included in your CSS file to perform this task?

In CSS3, you are working on paginations. You have designed your website with various page numbers where each page number represents a web page. If you are required to highlight your current page number, then which of the following classes must be used to perform this action?

In CSS3, you are working on the animation property of your website. Which of the following statements about subproperties of this property are correct:
    1. The animation-timing-function subproperty is used to configure the length of the time that animation must take to complete one cycle.
    2. The animation-delay subproperty is used to configure the delay between the time an element is loaded and the beginning of the animation sequence.
    3. The animation-iteration-count subproperty is used to configure the number of times the animation must repeat.

In CSS3, you are working on style images. You are given an image hackcss.jpg. You have embedded this image to your website by using an HTML file mysite.html and a CSS file mysite.css. If you are required to display the circled image of the radius 35.5% of the original radius of the same image, then which of the following image properties in the CSS file is used to perform this task?

In CSS3, you are working on buttons. You have created a website in which you have embedded a button to navigate to another webpage of your website. You must design your button by using your CSS file such that it has only a green border color. The button must be filled with white color and the text on the button of black color. Which of the following properties are required in this scenario:
    1. background-color
    2. color
    3. border-opacity:rgb
    4. border

What is the output of the following HTML and CSS codes:

login.html

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
    <head>
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css">
    </head>
    <body>
        <h1>Welcome to HackerEarth!</h1>
        <div class = "mylogin">
            <form action="index.html">
                <p>
                    <label for="username">UserName</label>
                    <input type="text" name="username" id="username" placeholder="Enter your username"><br/>
                </p>
                <p>
                    <label for="password">Password </label>
                    <input type="password" name="password" id="password" placeholder="Enter your password" maxlength="8"><br/>
                </p>
                <p>
                    <input type="submit" name="clickme" id="clickme" value="Login">
                </p>
            </form>
        </div>
    </body>
</html>

 

styles.css

body{
    height: auto;
    background-image: linear-gradient(yellow 10%, green 85%);
    background-repeat: no-repeat;
    background-size: 100% 100%;
    background-attachment: fixed;
}
h1{
    text-align: center;
    text-shadow: 2px 2px 5px black;
}
div.mylogin{
    display: block;
    text-align: center;
}
form
{
    display: inline-block;
    text-align: center;
    border: solid black 1px;
    width: 20%;
    border-radius: 5px;
    margin-left: auto;
    margin-right: auto;
    padding: 50px;
    background-image: radial-gradient(orange 10%, blue 85%);
}
